page.title: 15HEALTH
page.content: In 1985 you can get injections to protect you from many of the commonist childrens illnesses; there are injections against polio, whooping cough, diptheria, chicken pox and measles. Also girls have a Rubella injection so that if later on they become pregnant they can't catch German Measles which could make the baby handicapped. Round about 1965 they started doing heart transplants. After a transplant one man lived for eight years. They are now trying the transplantation of heart and lungs. Recently a baby died after a heart-lung transplant. Another common illness of the 20th century is cancer, which is cuurently under research with the hope that a cure will be found.
